Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but starting to look a bit old”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, just a short walk from Terminal 1 by bridge. The bridge is also conveniently located on the side of Terminal 1 where the airport train goes to Terminal 2, so it's convenient for that terminal also. Friendly staff, efficient service, good food, reasonable price. But the public areas, carpets, furniture are looking in need of renovation. It was clean and quiet, bedding was comfortable. Several English t.v. channels including CNN. The wifi in the room was not free, but was fast. Nice shampoos and amenities in the bathroom. Convenience store shops nearby inside the airport terminal, I believe some are open 24 hours. You have to ask for a minibar key at check in. I arrived as a distressed passenger due to Avianca flights being typically late, and at 10 pm, there was quite a long line for checkin, and I expect they are full many nights. There is a Hilton Hotel directly inside Terminal 1, which looked more modern but I didn't get to see the inside. It looked like there was also a hotel inside Terminal 2 (Aeromexico, Delta, Lan), but I also didn't go inside that. Even at the last minute, the price I paid was reasonable for the convenience and overall quality. There is also a bus shuttle which is free, that goes to Terminal 2, which is a bit more convenient with luggage than taking the free Airport train. If you're between flights for a day, it's not a bad place to stay, as you can go into Mexico City by taxi, not too far away, but you probably won't want to make the trek more than the one day in one day. No frequent flyer mileage credit with any program other than Aeromexico.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than I expected....”
Reviews.Author: KenRichMun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Camino Real in the Mexico City airport on 2 separate nights - once on the way to Costa Rica, and once on the way back (layovers). Because I have seen way too many movies I had a very strange idea of what to expect with this hotel and the airport itself. I am glad to report that I was very wrong in both aspects. First off - the hotel is located just off of Terminal 1 at Gate (Sala) B which is pretty much near the end of the airport. As soon as you get through customs just go out into the main area (and behold the huge amount of airport police with bright orange hats and not a single person hassling you) and hang a left. Eventually make your way to the upper level and just keep on walking. Through the windows you will eventually see the huge Camino Real looming just across the street. Take the bright covered walkway over to the hotel and there you are. I had our confirmation #'s handy but giving my last name was good enough. Signing in took less than a minute and we were on our way. The lobby of the hotel is pretty nice and the hotel has a comforting feel to it. The carpets and the elevators and the hallways could use a bit of sprucing up but the rooms themselves were perfect - very clean, super soft beds, large pristine bathrooms - I was nicely surprised considering how some the reviews weren't all that positive. Mind you, on one of the TV channels in the hotel rooms there is this non-stop loop of various Camino Real hotels - and a bunch of them look amazing......quite luxurious in fact so if someone frequented these 5-star Camino Reals and then stayed at this airport one I could see them being a little bummed - but I never have so I wasn't! Anyways, my wife and I ate at one of their restaurants - I don't recall the name of it but it was a little bit of a walk away from the lobby/bar area and resembled a cafeteria - food was pricey and gross. Follow other reviewers advice and just eat at places in the terminal (they have 2 'wings' restaurants 50 feet apart which I found kind of funny). There are a bunch of choices. So other than the worn carpets/walls and the unsavoury restaurant book your overnight at the Camino Real rather than the Hilton, it's totally worth it. Also note that there are a ton of other hotels just a few minutes outside of the airport grounds (Camino Real and Hilton are essentially part of the airport). I believe a few of the nearby hotels offer free shuttle service. If I ever pass through Mexico City airport again and have to stay overnight this will be the place - $130 well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanned
Reviews.Content: Huge elegant lobby, beautiful rooms, very comfortable beds, great bathroom, good price. Minus that there is no free wifi. Hotel easily accessible through a special glassed in bridge from the airport ie very safe! Much better and cheaper than the Hilton (where I also stayed).

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: Irochka77
Reviews.Content: We have been there only for one night. The staff was friendly. The location is excellent if you have an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AlexPuente
Reviews.Content: Excellent airport hotel, very good service, location and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Probably too critical but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kfhm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night when I had a early flight. The hotel is very convenient with a 2-3 minute walk to the terminal. The rooms were large and clean with all the amenities. (Except no alarm clock) The beds were fine, perhaps a bit hard. You cannot beat the location, unless you stay at the Hilton. The hotel is older and needs upkeep. The carpets were well worn. The tub in my bathroom was peeling whatever the coating was that was on it. There were 3 resturants, all very expensive. You are better off going over to the terminals to eat. I was not impressed with my meal at the resturant especially considering the prices. I did not find the staff particularly friendly or helpful. They did not seem to want to go out of their way to provide service. They were not unfriendly but not overly welcoming. Too many transient travelers I assume. I think the thing that bothered me the most was the charge to print your boarding pass. I am use to hotels providing this service for free. Just left a bad taste in my mouth, I'd rather go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good irprt stopover”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: Great location, very quiet rooms, good linens (too many cushions on the beds!) plenty of hot water...... need...... coffee maker and bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat convenient and serves good food”
Reviews.Author: hrimhari
Reviews.Content: It's next to the airport's Terminal 1 and serves good authentic Mexican food. Other than that, its renovation date is past due. We did like our room service order of chilaquiles, quesadillas and enchiladas. Much, much better than the ones served by Wings in Terminal 2 at a similar price range. Since we were coming and leaving through Terminal 2, which is on the other side of the landing tracks, the hotel wasn't exactly around the corner. A/C didn't work. I talked to the reception about it and they said they'd send somebody, but nobody came. I took a look at the system and got the impression that the cooling option wasn't even branched in: the socket for cooling inside the temperature control had no wire. I could smell the humidity in the dependencies. Overall, not exactly a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Structural flaws???”
Reviews.Author: CamyR
Reviews.Content: These people made a handicap ramp right ON the room entrance door. When we saw the entrance to the room, we asked for another room and they could not care less. I took a picture of this bizarre situation. The only nice things in here: the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: islandhoppers
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write negative reviews, so this is a first. I am a business traveler, and so I see a lot of hotels, in a lot of countries. There is no excuse for how dirty my room was. I was only there overnight, so I had no way to really deal with it - I was there to sleep - but was disgusted by the state of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Alla-Rustica
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you are overnighting in Mexico City to catch another flight or bus. You don't have to leave the airport to stay here which is a bonus if you are not comfortable knocking around this huge, polluted and sometimes unsafe city. My favourite bits are the lobby bar which is panelled with alabaster slabs and has a really good band playing till late mist nights and the Cualli restaurant that serves authentic Mexican fare. Service was marvellous and accommodated my veganism gracefully. The things I didn't like is that it's starting to show signs of age at some hallways and elevators which is surprising because it is a relatively new hotel and the strong smell of cleaning liquids. The hotel is a bit in the pricy side but if your priority is a good night's rest without leaving the airport (staying at other hotels is always an option but be reminded traffic is beyond hectic and a flop of logistics can have you stranded for hours) stay here (I've yet to try the Hilton). Clean just as I like it ;)

Reviews.Title: “If you can avoid it”
Reviews.Author: Engin22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels but Camino Real Aereopuerto is the first time I have to decide between the toilet or the shower to brush my teeth, I call them to fix the sink and a light after more than an hour I was left with no sink and the light was never fixed, that was not all the bar was too loud so I couldnÂ´t sleep so I was there just to spend 6 hrs. and catch an early flight but was a complete mistake

Reviews.Title: “An expensive bed...better than being ripped off by the taxi drivers”
Reviews.Author: Smurf52
Reviews.Content: My flight to Puebla was cancelled so I ended up in Mexico City instead. Camino Real is across the street from Terminal 1 so you can't beat the location. (This was after getting ripped off by a taxi driver trying to take me to a fleabag downtown) It is very clean. The room was noisy... but it was spacious and also very clean. Sorry, I didn't check out the bar or the restaurant all I wanted was sleep. I agree with my fellow travelers... it is a great place to stay if you have an early departure or a late arrival. But, you're gonna pay for the convenience. Oh, I would be remiss in not mentioning that they have free snacks until 2130 and a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels are airport hotels..... That being said my room at the executive (8th) floor was fully equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to spend the night for a flight the next day”
Reviews.Author: FiscalFox
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by a friend for a layover. After reading some of the reviews I'll admit I was not looking forward to my stay here as a lot of reviews made it sound like a flea-pit. In reality it was a clean, and spacious place. The room (floor 4) was large, tidy and modern, boasting a large double bead, desk, television and opulent shower facilities. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel appeared as if it had been recently renovated so perhaps these changes have gone someway to improving the overall look of the hotel; there were no 1970's carpets to speak of that were mentioned in other reviews. The only real caveat I had was that the reception smelt a little bit like drains, which I had read about. Bottom line, if you're staying over night in Mexico city for a flight, book in here. It's stuck on the side of the airport so you can't go wrong. Whilst I wouldn't stay here for a trip to Mexico city (it's miles from out of town) I would recommend it for a layover.

Reviews.Title: “VERY convenient when flying early--attached to airport”
Reviews.Author: Melovechocolate
Reviews.Content: My hotel room was clean, the front desk was friendly..I can tell that the bathroom needed some updating, the tub looked a bit worn (but not bad)..This hotel is extremely convenient because it is attached to the airport, so you just cross a well-lit, enclosed, see through bridge and you walk right into the airport. Since my flight was leaving at 9am, this worked out very well. My room had a view to the back of the hotel, and it was a slum. Since i was spending only a few hours there to sleep, it wasn't an issue for me. I guess you can try asking for a nicer view if that kind of thing bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for air port layovers”
Reviews.Author: Rupesh72
Reviews.Content: Used the room when i had a layover between flights.It was a very good choice due to its proximity to the airport.The buffet breakfast was good. Access to the food outlets of the airport was a couple of minutes walk . The view of the airport and the runways was breathtaking. Wifi worked at very good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Juan R
Reviews.Content: I had no choice but to stay at this hotel only because there were rooms available. The price I paid for one night is definitely not worth the outrageous amount of money that they charge. The location is good, of course, but that doesn't mean that they can rip people off. The hotel facilities are old and I never felt like they really cared about me being a guest at the hotel. I called the service desk several times and they put me on hold for over 5 minutes. While I was showering power went out and did not come back until an hour later. Overall I don't recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for overnighting.”
Reviews.Author: IPAgenoa
Reviews.Content: When I was in the aviation business, I simply loved this hotel that overviews the twin runways of Mexico City's international airport and, far in the background the smoking Popocatepl. Land connections to nearby airports, such as Toluca's, are excellent; shopping is a short hop to the Terminal; food is excellent both at the hotel itself and at the Terminal. The S.ra Norma Velazquez Zenteno, Rooms Division Manager, is hospitable and accomodating. The trip to the Mexico City's Zona Rosa and its shopping and eating is ok if taken outside the horrible morning and evening after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Medicore Service but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorPaul
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the positives: - Great location to the airport and free shuttle service to Terminal 2 - Very large and well equipped Fitness Center - Good choice of restaurants within the hotel - WiFi available - Large bar area in lobby area - Very nice breakfast buffet - Nice supply of hot water for the showers The negatives: - Poor response from the main desk....no one answers the phone - Hotel looks "tired"....needs a renevation - Internet service was down for 12 hours

Reviews.Title: “10 minutes from the gates and what a fitness center”
Reviews.Author: jbonaventure
Reviews.Content: located just across terminal 2, waking distance. Fitness center ( huge gym, pool and spa located on the 8th floor, looking out. , world class

Reviews.Title: “Holiday weekend in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela V
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but the construction by the lobby was noisy and dusty. I had three rooms reserved and paid off when I arrived they said I only had two rooms, good thing I had my confirmation printed out. I entered the names of the people in each room by the time I reserved, but unfortunately they only registered my name and my mom missed a visit because her name was not in their computer.The rooms need a little more options for ilumination. We waited one hour to get two coffees in the lobby.... We stayed two nights and the second day none of the room keys worked, we had to go downstairs to reset them, they said it was because they were magnitized which is not true, it is unconfurtable not to have the card ready to open the room when it should be working. The bathtubs in two rooms didn't drain, they fixed the problem but still was inconvenient. Checking out was easy and fast but not too cordial. Note: Carpets on the ailes were poor and had some holes on them.

Reviews.Title: “Only for a layover, no more”
Reviews.Author: tamayoma
Reviews.Content: Its a good option when you have an early flight , service its ok, don't expect more... now they are refurbishing., but only the lobby..although needs more in the hallways... Rooms have been refurbished, but don't expect for a bottle of water,or a hair dryer....of course internet is NOT free.. for breakfast restaurante las Huertas is ok, good service and food... BICE and la Mansion are other oprions for lunch or dinner.. THE worst....they charge for 8 hours around 20 US for parking, they cannot bill it to your room account, and it took 15 min to get my car... So try no to stay in this hotel if you have to park your car..ASK first in order to avoid a nasty surprise

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a layover or very short stay”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: Very convenient walking bridge that connects to terminal 1. Â Low quality and dated rooms, Very tiny as well, however gets 5 stars in cleanliness.Â Urges some upgrades to carpets and furnitures.Â Decor is random, nothing special about it.Â Room service is very fast, however food is very common and turisty. Definitely not the best mexican food.Â Staff was rude and some bellboys stared at me in an inappropriate way. It was uncomfortable and rude. Gym was very spacious and well equipped, such a shame the pool was too small.Â I'd recommend this hotel for a very short stay or layover since there's nothing to do in the surrounding area, bad neighbohoord and just custom broker agencies offices. However is very close to subway station which can take you anywhere in Mexico City. Watch the exchange rate and extra charges. I'd suggest staying at the Ramada instead, is trendier and also next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “watch the exchange rate”
Reviews.Author: Domers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Camino Real because we had an early flight the next day and it is connected to the airport. They had an advertised rate of $90 / night when booked through our travel agent. However when I arrived at the hotel the charge shown to me was 1134 MXN (pesos). Given that the current exchange rate wasw about 11.3 this corresponded to about $100. When I balked they told me that they have "their own" exchange rate. This is obviously a scam. They would not accept cash payment in dollars and so when this charge appears on my credit card bill it will be about $100 (plus taxes). Using an exchange rate to inflate the price is a clear scam. Buyer beware! Second complaint. They don't have free wireless in the rooms. You can sign up for internet for an expensive rate. Are you kidding me? Thrid, the staff are not cusotmer oriented. After lugging our luggage up to our room I found out the key didn't work. I trudged back down and left my wife waiting. I explained to the attendant at the desk what happened and she simply took the key , typed something into the system and said "aqui, lista" (here it's ready). No, I'm sorry sir - nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Good but charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: gabyrd80
Reviews.Content: I had to spend the night at Mexico CityÂ´s Airport to catch a flight the next morning. The location is very convenient if you need to catch a flight since is right across the terminal. You just need to cross the tunnel (no need for a cab). It's a tall building with small rooms but they are trendy and very comfortable. The downside is the extra fees: internet (bussines center or wifi), no drinking water in the room and the mini bar is very expensive. Other than that it is a good choice for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the hotel - stop at the Bice Bistro”
Reviews.Author: FRWL
Reviews.Content: Business meetings in Mexico City â€“ used colleagueâ€™s hotel room in Camino Real to freshen up and change for the meeting after a long flight in. The first impression of the hotel is that itâ€™s a remnant from the 60â€™s: an old, imposing, ugly cement structure, with worn out carpets, old-fashioned atrium, where you literally bake in the sun, beaming through the high glass roof. Yes, this was the style way-back-when â€“ time to step into the 21st century. The halls are dark, dingy, I had to maneuver through the mouse maze until I found the hotel room, all the way at the end of the twisting and turning narrow hall. The room itself was clean, with modern bathroom upgrades; but few people would get that far after the poor first impression. Honestly, I was glad I was only using it for 30 min, and not staying overnight. My colleagues and I had lunch at the Bice Bistro â€“ and I would return for another meal. We were seated promptly, the waiter was very attentive. Our meal selections were all delicious: I absolutely loved my sea bass ceviche â€“ perfectly marinated large chunks of fish, in â€œhome-madeâ€� green salsa, which was very flavorful, with just enough spice punch. The tortilla chips on the side should have been served whole, as opposed to cracked into small pieces. My colleaguesâ€™ comments on fried calamari and tempura-style veggies were also positive, as well as another selection of a small fillet steak, artfully presented on a plate with mashed potatoes, veggies and sauce. Canâ€™t comment on the price [I did not pay the bill], but the bistroâ€™s dÃ©cor, good service and delicious food was a pleasant lunch experience during the hectic business day.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable beds, great airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nedgulden
Reviews.Content: Wow! Is the word to discribe this airport hotel. Location is super convenient for a late arrival/early departure flight. The room is quiet, luxuriously appointed, with superbly confortable bedding, marble bathroom, furniture and lighting. Spotlessly clean room, friendly, efficient staff and nice on site restaurants albeit a bit expensive. This is a great hotel to catch your breath after a tiring day flying. I cant wait to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: nitinjain
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Mexico for sometime but this was my worst stay. Poor service. People don't understand English and that's too bad for a 5 star rated hotel. Smelly rooms. Rooms smell of paint and polish. The concierge service is so poor that they keep you on hold for long.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds. Claustrophobic rooms :(”
Reviews.Author: skyserf
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe there are so many good reviews for this hotel. The beds are very uncomfortable, some kind of foam mattress and they are small. The rooms are like sweat boxes. I have to stay here from time to time because of work. Maybe 8 times a year. I always dread staying here because I can't get any rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at Mexico City airport - but watch the extras !”
Reviews.Author: Bethpagejet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected on the basis of being close to the airport (right next to terminal 1), and my room (631) had excellent views of the airport and the arriving and departing airplanes right out the window. Really good if you like that sort of thing - like I do ! I stayed one night before flying out the next morning (had a free shuttle to terminal 2). The room was very nice and well appointed, but the car parking charges are excessive (a lot higher than the website states). The site states 20 MXD/day (approx Â£2.30), but I left my rental car there for approx 4 hours before I returned it and they charged me 180 MXD (about Â£10) - try arguing about that in Spanish ! The charge for internet access at such a large and popular hotel (Â£14/day approx) was a complete rip-off. I suggest you check alternatives if you plan an extended stay and your company isn't paying the bill. There is a shop in the lobby for snacks, drinks and magazines etc. I didn't try the restaurant, cafe or bar, but I did have a club sandwich and a beer from room service which was very nice and reasonably priced. With the above reservations I would still recommend it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough this time”
Reviews.Author: dumid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a second time due to my flight cancellation, threfore the room was paid by the airline company. I stayed this time in the new tower, rooms are great, no complaints except maybe that this one has a shower not a bathtub as we got in the old tower first time. Check-in was slow due to lots of people from the cancelled flight, check out was fast. Cannot understand from where it comes the moldy smell in the lobby, thanks God in the rooms the air is ok. Anyway, it was an ok experience but when I am on my own I choose Ramada- better rates, free parking, free wirelles, included bufee breakfast in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by Mexico City airport”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdroguÃ©
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with some friends when our Aeromexico flight to Buenos Aires was cancelled. The hotel was very convenient. Food was great, there are free shuttles to the airport terminals every 15 minutes and the staff is very helpful. The rooms are relatively small but very well appointed and clean. Marble bathrooms are also very nice and the beds are superb, similar to any 4 star American chain hotel. I would definitely stay here again. I would define

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your belongings or take them with you”
Reviews.Author: PDKERSCH
Reviews.Content: Had my Bose Headphones stolen from my suitcase the one day I left them in the hotel. Fortunately had all my other equipment with me. Hotel investigated but could not find any truth to my claim. The hotel rooms are very dated and worn as well. I'll find another place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: We stayed after a flight delay meant that we missed our connection to Acapulco. Several transatlantic flights had been cancelled and the hotel was in chaos (they should be used to this as are used by several major airlines) and we had to wait nearly an hour to check in. Under normal circumstances we would have gone elsewhere but had 9 suitcases so were not very mobile. The whole hotel is tired and old, the hotel carpets extremely shabby as was our room which looked old and dirty. We went down to the restaurant to have the buffet dinner at La Huerta which was not cheap but totally uninspired, lacking both variety and flavor. Camino Real is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, but neither the dinner nor the room were that of anything other than the cheapest motel. We paid rack rate $300 US for 4 hours sleep ! We had another bad experience with Camino Real Pedregal earlier this year and will avoid this chain like the plague in the future. They need to up their game in both service and installations. If you need a hotel in Mexico City airport, go to the new NH hotel at Terminal 2 whose rooms are spacious, attractive and new. It will cost you the same but much MUCH better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't find our booking!”
Reviews.Author: Cuba88
Reviews.Content: I booked this accommodation online three weeks prior to needing it, only to arrive at 11pm, and to find that they don't have my reservation despite the fact I have a confirmed acommodation voucher from otel.com. Given our arrival time, there was no one they could ring, and they would not let us into the room without swiping my credit card. Not happy given I had several emails from otel.com, saying my credit card had been charged, and that all I had to do was take the accommdation voucher with me. By the time this was all resolved it was about 12.30am. Not great, since we had to check out at 5am for our flights the next morning. The hotel is very convenient if all you need to do is sleep and then get up to catch your flight the next day, you just have to walk across a boardwalk / airbridge. So that was one saving grace. The rooms were clean, but hey all we wanted was a hot shower (of which they had) and a bed to sleep in. The only problem was our room was right beside the elevators. Luckily I was so tired that we eventually dropped off. Value can't really comment, because it was 2am by the time we'd packed, showered and piled into bed. So three hours sleep makes the room pretty pricey. I'm still awaiting the outcome with otel.com / Camino Real Aeropuerto as to whether I've been charged once or twice. Very disappointed that my voucher wasn't honoured and we lost valuable sleep time because of it. Front Desk was not helpful out all, and unfortunately for them they are the face of the hotel ie your first point of contact.

Reviews.Title: “Embarrased and cheated in Bice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Tristed
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the Bice Bistro restaurant in the hotel by a lot of advertising within the hotel. Actually we enjoyed our Mediterranean inspired meal, until the bill came. The prices were high but we sort of expected that. What we didn't expect was a "cubierto", a cover charge of about $2 US each for the priviledge of sitting in our chairs. We have never experienced this before in any restaurant unless there was entertainment, but there was none. We signed the check to our hotel room and were walking out when just outside the door, in front of several people, the waiter stopped us and said something about not paying the bill. We showed him our room key which matched the bill we signed and he seemed satisfied. However, when we were passing the front desk, a restaurant hostess stopped us, waving the bill and saying that we had no credit at the hotel. Apparently the hotel had forgotten to ask us for a credit card on registering and did not okay the charge, a mistake on the part of the hotel. A very heated and very public conversation then occured after which the restaurant agreed to cancel the cover charge and the hotel agreed to accept the charge. Later the hotel apologized but the resuarant did not. We were very embarassed by being stopped twice, publicly as though we were common thieves. We are experienced travellers and have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times before during trips between Mexicoa and Canada. I don't think we will again. In addition to the embarrasing restaurant experience, we noted that the maintenance has gone down. It was very hard if not impossible to turn the taps off in the bathroom and the bath tub stopper would not hold water in the tub. The only plus in our stay was that the hotel staff were all very pleasant but that is not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Correct”
Reviews.Author: johnweir
Reviews.Content: Okay for a stopover I used this Hotel frequently as it is handy for the airport for the next days flight. Food is average,,,, bar service was good with a very entertaining barman.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, smelly, and dated.. DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: CaboGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. The hotel is very convenient to the airport - a short shuttle ride from Terminal 2 or a bridge that connects to Terminal 1. When you walk into the hotel though, you are overwhelmed by a smell of mold and chemicals. The rooms are very dated and the smell is worse - damp, moldy, with a chemical cleaning smell on top of it. I switched rooms 3 times - the first room I tried to live with, but after being in there for 30 minutes, my throat hurt from the chemical smell. The 2nd room was just as bad. Finally the 3rd room was bearable, but still noticeable. The furnishings are horribly dated - feels very 1970s. Pillows are flat, sheets worn, old tube style TV, etc. The bathroom of the first room was very small, and the faucets turned on easily but were then hard to turn off. 3rd room bathroom was bigger and faucet functioned. Unlike the previous reviewer, I had hot water, but little water pressure. My alarm clock was broken - the numbers displayed in nonsense form and you couldn't shut it off, nor could you unplug it b/c it was wired to the wall. So I had to turn the volume down low and put a pillow on top to block the static noise. I asked for it to be replaced but it never was. Luckily the wakeup calls were reliable, and even came twice- once from a computer and once from a human. The internet system is EXTREMELY frustrating and expensive. ($20 US for 24 hrs) They have no wireless in the rooms - so you have to call downstairs to the business center. They will bring you a cable and a login/password for the internet. Even once you have the cord, you still have to call down for the code once your time expires. The code has to be brought to you on a card that you sign for. Very frustrating to have to wait 15-20 minutes for the card to arrive when you just want to hop on line to check email. For a business hotel, this is nothing but silly. When I pushed them to give me the code on the phone, the staff member put me on hold and never came back (TWICE this happened!). The rooms either overlook the airport or slums in the back. Breakfast buffet was ok but expensive ($25 US) for what it was. Business colleague had her car in valet and when we needed to get it out, it was a huge process that took 45 minutes. I will say that the staff (other than the internet guy who put me on hold and never came back), was very polite and friendly, and were very accomodating at switching my room, etc. That's really the only positive thing I can say about this place. I've stayed in the Camino Real in Mexico City proper, and that was very nice. I'd never stay in this one again, however. There is a Ramada nearby and other airport hotels - choose one of those if you need to stay by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: jdpd57
Reviews.Content: I need it to stay close to the airport to catch an early flight; the facilities are renewed but nothing to compare on the service to the other Camino Real Mariano Escobedo; there was no hot water in my room, a baby cried all night on the next contiguous room and sound like there where no walls, denied a glass of water and invite me to purchase a bottle of water for $2.00 Us dls.

Reviews.Title: “OK for layover”
Reviews.Author: CuriousFlyer
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much and the Mexico airport Camino Real met my expectations ! I booked the cheapest rate I could find (with Orbitz it turned out, under $100) as we had a 15 hours layover in Mexico between flights. The hotel paid us back in return by giving us a crappy small smoking room with a queen bed. Everything there was old and tired and of dubious cleanliness: the bed and bedsheets, bathroom, AC and TV. The internet never worked and cost $20, but this was refunded at checkout. The breakfast buffet was greasy and dry and not cheap ($20 each again). The swimming pool was undergoing repairs. What was good about it? The location! Getting there was a breeze, no need to rely on these elusive airport shuttles, only an overpass to cross from T1, we loved this. Also, it was interesting to walk in the streets behind the hotel and see that the airport is surrounded by a dense city with housing and restaurants! Finally the style of the hotel, although very tired and a bit tacky, will very much please the 70s lovers! I am not recommending this hotel but not exactly telling you not to go either. Go with low expectations if you get a low price and it is convenient for your flights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dumid
Reviews.Content: Indeed excellent hotel, very convenient after a long flight, basically in the terminal 1. connected with it by a tunnel that crosses the street. we had a beautiful view towards the airport which was great for some airplanes spotting. The room is very big for european standards, nice amenitties, big screen tv, large bathroom, comfy bed, excellent breakfast, though a little bit expensive for Mexico (480mxn for two) good staff. Did not have time to try the pool&gym. Be ready to tip anyone and everywhere. I really reccomend it especially if you arrive late night after a long flight. The hotel itself is a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “it is not a myth! it is reality!”
Reviews.Author: Giesemann
Reviews.Content: i heard a lot of scary stories about this hotel, but never experienced such a poor and unprofessional service like i did today at this hotel. believe me, i travel a lot, and the only reason i stayed in this hotel is because i arrieved at 23:00 and have a 7:00 flight. when you get to the front desk they ask you what kind of room you want so they can have fun with you and send you to the complete oposite type. then i asked to pay my room and internet connection and get my receipt at the moment so i would not have to come by the front desk for check out, but front desk clercks think guests are stupid! the girl just charged me and gave me a receipt for my payment but not an invoice as i requested long story short, it took me over an hour to get a room as i requested, a receipt and internet access, because it does not work in all rooms!, can you imagine! and they call it a 5 star Camino Real??

Reviews.Title: “Great for layovers-Thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: j10oreo
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to find out that the hotel was connected to the Domestic terminal of the airport via sky walkway. When we arrived at the hotel half hour after check in time, our room was not ready. We had booked a king size bed. They gave us the choice of taking a room with two twin beds or wait an hour for a king size bed. We took the twin beds. As we walked to our room we did nothing but complain to our bellboy. Five minutes after we arrived to our room our bellboy called us and said he somehow found us a king size room. How he did it I don't know but he got a big tip for taking care of us. The internet was expensive but we chose not to purchase it. We did however, take advantage of the gym. Best gym so far in Mexico! It had countless cardio machines each with a personal tv. It had a large weight room with a personal trainer. It also had an above ground pool but we did not swim. The Italian restaurant inside the hotel was a little pricey. A Jack and Coke was $15 USD. They somehow got us to buy a pizza appetizer which cost more than one of our entrees. The bar was ok. There was a live band playing 70's and 80's songs in the bar which extends to the hotel lobby. (Not my type of music). Another plus was that the metro station is right outside the domestic terminal. We got to visit the historic Mexico City one last time before we flew out the next day. I would only stay at this hotel for layovers or catching an early flight- Nothing else!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: shawninottawa68
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the business travel. Attached to the airport, so it is convenient for access to the airport. Good restuarants on site (3 plus a bar). The fitness centre is OK, but the pool is not very good. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Staff are helpful. Room rates are very good. The internet access is a little pricey though. Overall it is a good place to stay. If you are adventerous you can take the Metro downtown from the airport for only 2 pesos (or 20 cents Cdn). Tours can be arranged at the hotel, and I arranged one to the Aztec pyriamids (cash only).

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good at the Camino REal Aeropuerto”
Reviews.Author: LatinBaseballFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six days during the 2009 World Baseball Classic at nearby Foro Sol Stadium. I always believe in delivering the good news first, so here goes: 1) As many in other reviews have noted, the hotel is basically only a sky-bridge walk away from the international terminal at the Mexico City airport yet one never hears the airport noise. 2) Service was excellent and staff was extremely helpful. Many spoke English. 3) Workout Room/Spa was very nice with tons of equipment and a relaxing steam room. 4) Breakfast brunch was a great value with plenty of fresh food. 5) Lobby was spacious, clean and well designed. 6) Free shuttle service to the airport is nice. 7) Guided tour of the Pyramid of the Sun with an English-speaking guide that allows pickup at the hotel is a good value at $45. Now, what you really need to know: 1) Business center charges 5 pesos per minute; it ain't free. They never tell you that. 2) Hotel taxis are a ripoff charging four times that of conventional fares; get your taxi just behind the hotel by walking through the bus depot via a right turn at the sky bridge and follow to the rear of the hotel. 3) Hotel food is very expensive. Great taco stand also located behind the hotel with cheap food; Mexicana stewardesses routinely eat here, so I figured it had to be healthy and good. It was. 4) Sky bridge allows easy access to the airport shops and eateries; suggest you avoid eating at the hotel and if you want a burger at Burger King for the kids, go to the airport. A very clean, safe and efficient airport. 5) Lap pool at the hotel is a joke. Put two people in the pool and it's crowded and you can cover a lap in seven normal strokes. But there is tons of workout equipment and spin cycles available FREE to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dagger_TO
Reviews.Content: Being on business in Mexico for the first time and having a tight schedule staying at this hotel the day of arrival and day of departure made things that much more simple. The hotel walkway it is quite a hike from/to the international section of the airport, 15-20 min at an unsure pace. Both checkins were quick since they were mid-afternoon though I did notice long lineups later on. Airline employees seem to just walk up to the counter and get service however. The rooms were small but clean and quiet. Both times I was in the north tower and had a view of nothing basically. The breakfast buffet was varied and quite good. I found it quite expensive but nothing beats the convenience especially the night before a departing flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: truck2chief
Reviews.Content: We arrived late almost 11pm & upon arrival were greeted immediately & had the most effortless checkin of my life I just gave my name & had 2 room keys for each room handed over to me in seconds. I did not even have to produce my credit card which shocked me I merely showed my passport to verify my name and we were off to our rooms. The hotel is extremely well kept & the beds are probably the most comfortable I have ever slept on in mexico. I know the Camino has a really good reputation but this hotel deserves a higher ranking then it has received to date I could not find any fault. I would suggest purchasing some water & snacks before you arrive at the hotel as there are no vending machines here & to make use of the in room refrigerator is very expensive in comparision to grabbing something at the airport before crossing the Pedestrian bridge to the Hotel from the Airport. The breakfast buffet is outstanding & for an airport hotel in the heart of the city I expected to pay an arm & a leg but it was very reasonable & the food & selection was outstanding. As I dined here on valentines day they had a Mariachi band playing & gave roses to all the woman in my family which I thought to be a very nice touch from a very classy organization. They have a rooftop pool that overlooks the airport that was very nice & we used it briefly before we had to head back to the airport for our connecting flight. I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Sailor-NHYC
Reviews.Content: If you have an early flight out in the morning, this is the place to stay. The hotel is clean and quiet. Staff are friendly and helpful. Restaurant food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Checkin EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Flight
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying at this hotel and I have to say that I was shocked that there was a line up of about 30 people in front of me and it was taking well more than 5 minutes per person to be checked in and no wonder because there was only one person doing the checkin. After 30 minutes of virtually no advancement in the line up, I decided to go to the front and request to talk to the manager, I told her that this was non acceptable and that this has been the worst checkin experience of my whole life and I travel quite a lot through Europe, Asia, and North America. She was nice enough to say that they were doing all they could to expedite the process and that the reason that the line up was so long was that an unexpected flight was arriving, however I looked back on the line and there were well above 50 people waiting. Other customers were really pissed as well and started to complain. This is simply unacceptable, I was very pissed off. Also, when you arrive the bell boys do not great you at the door to help you out with the bags, only after you check in, this was a very bad thing in my opinion, particularly because the entrance has some steps and the ramp was not easy to access. Now that I think about it, the reason for this is that you typically tip the guy that helps out with the bags to your room and not the guy that helps you to get to checkin counter, my guess is that the bell boys have learnt this and do not even bother anymore at the entrance. Again, this is a very bad thing to happen in a Camino Real. The room were ok and view as well, but for a Camino Real below its typical standard. I had another problem at check out, but this one is a long story and even remembering makes me un easy. Overall, this is an OK Hotel, but the little things that make a great hotel are simply missing in this one.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: I was in Mexico City and wanted something close to the airport. There are many choices but I have stayed at other Camino locations within Mexico and very much liked them so I decided to give this one a shot. Besides being able to walk there from the airport, I was not impressed. The rooms are more expensive than other airport locations (offering free transportation), they charge you for internet access, and the food was a disappointment. The staff was very slow and really didn't seem to care about the customer which was a surprise. All of the other Camino locations have bent over backwords to take care of the customer. This location acted like it was a chore. Next time I'm in Mexico City I'll book the Fiesta Inn.

Reviews.Title: “loved the real”
Reviews.Author: mossycheshire
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic over the walkway to airport, the hotel staff were so efficent and helpfull, clean rooms excellent bar. the manager said to me we are like a family and this isare home, and you felt like being at home, the staff make the hotel, would return there again

Reviews.Title: “Bad news on arrival”
Reviews.Author: ulrik1
Reviews.Content: The fast connection from airport does not apply to international arrivals to terminal 2. You need to take a 15 min shuttle bus or airport train. Never book the room on arrival. I had to pay at least two times the going rate and when I left the following morning I did not notice that they had charged me for breakfast. Note that the dining room opens at 5am so there is no way I could have had breakfast. Dinner in coffe shop is booring and totally non mexican

Reviews.Title: “Best option at the airport!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Afanny
Reviews.Content: Confortable and nicely decorated rooms. Impressed because the hotel is connected to the airport and I never heard and aiplane. Good restaurants, view and service.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from airport”
Reviews.Author: redalligator
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as somewhere to crash out after a long flight from Europe. I also stayed here the night before I left Mexico City to fly back to the UK. The hotel is perfectly adequate. It is linked to the airport by an elevated walkway adjacent to the domestic terminal. It is only a few minutes walk from the international arrivals. Good sized bedrooms and very clean bathrooms. Quite quiet despite being so close to the runway. I did ask to be moved from the first room allocated to me as it overlooked a mass of aircon fans & was rather noisy. The first night's room 'overlooked' a wall at the back of the hotel. The second night's room had a view over the airport. Good breakfast buffet. The evening meal in one of the hotel restaurants was perfectly acceptable. I was able to arrange at late check-out at 18:00 with no problems. If you want to go down-town using the underground, the station is approx. five minutes walk away. All-in-all a perfectly acceptable choice if you want to crash out somewhere close to the airport after a long flight. A bit pricey, but then you are paying for the convenient loctaion

Reviews.Title: “fine for over night stop”
Reviews.Author: borris
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 1am local time and an 18 hour trip encouraged us to book an over night stop in Mexico city airport. it was well worth it, the bed was very comfortable, we coulnt hear any noise from the airport and the tap water was drinkable! inspite of jet lag the comfort and tranquility of the room enabled us to get some sleep and then worry about battling through to the centre of mexico city after a nights sleep. am so glad we did as the hotel was worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pricey but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: We booked this because our flight arrived very late at night, and it was the closest hotel to the airport. We had a good nights sleep, on a good bed with thick curtains that made it easy to sleep. The front desk were helpful, and the tap-water was drinkable! I was most surprised to be told, but suffered no ill-effects. The breakfast was good, the only drawback was the price. Would use again under the same circumstances, if we'd have arrived earlier we could have made it into the center for cheaper accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient...but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Chiguire
Reviews.Content: The Camino Real is one of two hotels at the Mexico City airport with direct access to the terminal building (the other one is the Hilton). There is a covered/enclosed walkway linking the hotel lobby with the main terminal, thereby eliminating the need to catch a shuttle. Outside of this feature however, there isn't that much that distinguishes this hotel from others in the vicinity, especially considering the price difference. The rooms are average, albeit larger than the Hilton's, but with the same amenities. There is a well equipped, complimentary fitness center in the top floor, but the pool is a joke: 50 feet long and 3 feet deep. The internet access is via cable and it is not complimentary. It costs $21 for a 24-hour access period, $5 per hour. The room service prices are relatively higher than those of other hotels. I would reommend this hotel for those who appreciate the convenience, speed, and relative safety of walking to their flights. But I would caution the budget-conscious.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: yohannsetna
Reviews.Content: The only benefit of this hotel was the location, just a pedestrian bridge away from the airport. A great thing when you are flying over 20 hours from India to get there. The room was ok, clean sheets, clean carpet, etc. but NO tea /coffee making facilities in the room. What's that about? There was a nice big tub in the bathroom, and some nice bath gel, but no stopper in the tub, so how do u fill it up? TV channels were ok, but the retracting doors of the TV cabinet did not retract enough, and i kept banging into them, scraping quite a bit of skin off my shoulders. Ouch! Laundry was good, but the claimed same day service is only accurate if you live 48 hour days. Room Service was efficient. I ordered a Burger at 2 am one night. It arrived in 15 minutes, fresh, hot, and juicy. Coffee Shop food was ok. Breakfast spread was adequate. The nearby Angus restaurant, however, was a must try. Excellent food, nice ambience, and some very beautiful waitresses to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel -- just get some staff who understand hospitality”
Reviews.Author: apt5c
Reviews.Content: This could be a fine hotel--it's modern, the rooms are nice and well maintained, the Bistro restaurant we ate at was satisfactory. However, the staff seem to have their minds fixed solely on getting tips...while providing terrible service. We were ignored, then hassled, then lied to by the doormen and pestered by the waiters. The worst thing was when we pulled up in our rental car, we wanted to unload the luggage, check in, and then return the car to Hertz. The lead bellman tried to get us to hire his friend to return the car, at first saying it was a very difficult route to the car return, then saying he was unable to give us directions when we said we preferred to return it ourselves. First he said we couldn't leave our car in front of the hotel while we checked in (a matter of 10 minutes), then suggested we could if we tipped him appropriately for his trouble in "watching our car" as it sat in the driveway of the hotel. We did return the car ourselves, but no thanks to help from the hotel. A different bellboy in the lobby apparently got even with us for declining his help with our luggage (which was all on wheels) by misdirecting us to the elevators. But at least it's right at the airport, so we could skip the expensive hotel breakfast and have a fairly good inexpensive meal at the terminal a very short walk away. Our room was pleasant, quiet, and comfortable. Fortunately we had arranged a wake-up call, as there was a momentary power outage during the night that reset the electric alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Review Oct 8-15”
Reviews.Author: fakid
Reviews.Content: This is a 4-diamond property in the AAA standard. Personally I would give it a 4-star rating as well. This hotel is connected to the airport terminal through a bridge near Exit #4. At-airport-check-in is possible and the bellman would carry the suitcases to your room. The hotel has been completely renovated with beautiful and spacious rooms and restaurants. Very comfortable beds. It has everything you would expect from a medium-high end hotel. Thereâ€™s a mini-bar/fridge in room, but no coffee maker. The fitness center is big, but the pool is really too shallow like a Jacuzzi. The hotel doesnâ€™t provide bottled water because they claim their water is safe from the tap. The only major problem I had is the remote control and TV. They didnâ€™t seem to connect too well. The foreign (satellite) channels suffer frequently reception problem. Seems like the airplane landing and take off affect the reception. I requested for a room facing the airport since I enjoy plane spotting. However the first room I got (3131) is facing the car park building which means I couldnâ€™t open my curtains. The front desk then changed to change my room to 2 floors up (5128), which I get a better view of the runway. The alarm clock was missing in the second room, but I didnâ€™t bother to ask for one. The biggest advantage for staying at the airport hotel was that you could drop by the 7-11, food court, or internet cafÃ© at the terminal when you have nothing to do at night. The only reason I stayed at this hotel is because my company paid for it. Iâ€™m glad I wasnâ€™t staying at the Hiltonâ€™s given the reviews for it. Though, it is not very convenient to go Downtown if you donâ€™t have a driver. It takes about 45 minutes to get to Downtown by metro; 90miins return. Meal Vouchers: I was allowed 318 pesos for breakfast and dinner each day. The Breakfast BUFFET very good for only 95 pesos. Just the fresh-cut fruits alone you get like 8 choices. Dinner is served until 1am. You can get an 8oz. New York steak for 198 pesos or full size sandwich + full size pasta at the same price. (welcome to also see my trip report of the city)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: podoho
Reviews.Content: I don't see what's all the fuss about the priciness of this hotel. You're staying literally a two minute walk from the international terminal, which makes it very worthwhile when one is taking an early morning flight out of Mexico City. The price you pay extra for is for the ultimate convenience, and for us on our trip, it was well worth it rather than having to deal with early morning traffic. The room was as nice as any I've stayed at near any airport, quiet, clean, bed VERY comfortable, English speaking TV as well. The workout center/gym is well-stocked with not only treadmills but elliptical trainers. We ate at the Mexican restaurant in the hotel. Both of our meals were outstanding. We had a half-bottle of wine, great entrees, dessert, and an after dinner drink. The bill came to around 100 dollars, tip included. Let's face it - in the U.S. you're going to pay at least that for a good meal at a nice restaurant in a nice hotel near any airport. My recommendation is that you can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “If you must, it's convenient”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. Hotel is directly connected to airport. I used this for 1 night as had very early morning departure. Booked via Expedia, no problems. Hotel appears to have renovations under way. My room in the 2nd wing, was very small, 2 beds, relatively dimly illuminated. Bedding was just OK. Some street noise. Bathroom small as well, but well illuminated and in good order. If you come in late, or leave early - this facility is likely to be fine. It's the only 1 directly connected via a covered walkway, so convenience rules.

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: AEF_9
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay if you're flying out early in the morning. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with all the mod cons, and best of all the airport is only a 30 second walk across a footbridge. The rooms are also very well insulated, so you don't really hear the airport noise. The only disappointment was the night we stayed the room service wasn't available due to a problem with the gas in the kitchen. There are plenty of fast food outlets and a couple of restaurants at the airport though, it was just unfortunate that we wanted room service that night in particular. There was a bit of a queue at check-out at 5am when we had to get our flight, so take that into account, that everyone is likely to be rushing for flights when you leave and give yourselves and extra 15 mins or so.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erk08
Reviews.Content: The Camino Real group has done a good job remodeling this hotel. Its location can not be beat. You can walk across a bridge to the airport, and given Mexico City's unpredictable traffic, that can be a great comfort. Lobby bar and restaurants are above average for your typical airport hotel. Best value of the airport hotels in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “get place to relax before an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: MasterGee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property prior to taking an early morning flight back to the US. It was a pleasant surprise. The interior is modern, warm, and very comfortable. I wouldnt recommend this hotel if your desire to do any sightseeing, but for those needing a hotel very close to the airport (it is actually attached to the terminal), you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I missed my flight so I had to stay in a hotel. Even though I am familiar with Mexico City I felt overwhelmed in finding a safe hotel. The desk clerk at the airline I was traveling was nice enough to suggest Camino Real and made the reservation for me. At the entrance my bags were checked in and taken over by the bellman. After that my pleasant experience started. I had room service for dinner and breakfast which was delicious. All the employees were very courteous and efficient. My checkout was done in a very timely matter. My bags were taken all the way to the exit were the bellman hailed a baggage boy to take them all the way to the airline which I was going to fly out on the other side of airport. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would recommend to anyone. The view of the room was awesome. My window faced the domestic landing runway of the airport. Even with this it was quiet and I slept peacefully. The room was extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel - Can walk to the gate st the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Joe811
Reviews.Content: While it's not a lavish hotel, my room was clean, the staff very curtious, and the restaurants above standard. Unless you want to shop at the airport there isn't much to do as they definitely are catering to the business traveller. I didn't use the Business Center myself but did walk through & it seemed to have everything necessary. This hotel is best for overnight stays when catching an early flight or as a central point if you want to explore Mexico City on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate enough to take a 10 day trip to Mexico at the beginning of November. We stayed with a friend in Cuernavaca for 7 nights and at the Camino Real Aeropuerto in Mexico City for the last two nights. The hotel's location was convenient and the price was good... but the room was small and the bathroom could have been cleaned better. There were a couple of bolts sticking up out of the carpet on the bedroom floor that we both stubbed our toe or jammed our heel on in the middle of the night. It is located right next to the airport, but they did a fine job of sound insulation because we didn't hear a single plane the entire time. We did however hear the water squeeling throught the pipes at 6 a.m. when our neighbor took their shower both mornings. The waitstaff in the lounge area near the bar downstairs were just shy of rude. I have no doubt that part of this is because their 15% gratuity is automatically added to all tickets... but that's still no excuse. We arrived exhausted and hungry from Cuernavaca and this was the only place still open where we could grab a quick bite of food... it took forever and we practically had to chase down our waitress to get anything. Fortunately the rest of the staff was extremely helpful and tried their best to overcome the language gap (my husband and I piecing together the Spanish we've learned and them piecing together the English they know). All in all our stay was decent, but not spectacular. I expected more from a 4 star hotel, but at $102 a night I guess it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much To Recommend”
Reviews.Author: hankmancini
Reviews.Content: The one thing that I can say positive about the Camino Real Hotel at Mexico City Airport is that it is convenient. It connected to the domestic terminal by a "sky bridge" that leads directly into the hotel lobby. There is a bellman in the airport to help with luggage. It is also right on Circuito Interior (Rio Consulado) which makes getting to just about anywhere in or around Mexico City pretty easy. And, this is about all of the good that I can say about this hotel. Camino Real took over this hotel early in 2004 from Marriott. I had stayed once here when it was a Marriott and wrote a comment into Marriott that it was the worst Marriott that I had ever stayed at. My guess is that they received other many similar comments and that's why it is no longer a Marriott. Quite honestly, the service at this hotel is pretty good. I ate in one of the restaurants, ordered room service, and used the front desk several times. All of the staff was helpful and friendly. Everyone spoke English well enough. What is bad about this hotel is that it appears...shabby and not very well kept up. Sitting in my room (312) writing this, I think I have had better "looking" rooms at most motels that I have stayed at. It just looks dull and drab and I think that makes it easy for me to give this property a poor review. The carpet looks like it is in dire need of steam cleaning. The view from my room is onto the cooling system for the hotel. Besides the decor of the room, it lacks the one thing that is now essential in any hotel room, a high speed internet connection. Not only is there not one in the room, there is not one in the hotel, if you need to connect your laptop. There are a few computers in the business center that have broadband access, but that's it. In late 2004, this is just not reasonable for a business traveler. What else good can I say about this hotel? The beds were pretty comfortable. My room was cleaned and serviced well, which only shows up in the bathroom. I wish I had brought a level with me because I swear that this hotel is tilting. I could be wrong, but it is especially noticeable in the halls to me. The walls, floor, and ceiling just seem to be "out of kilter." The lobby area is not something that I typically care about, but the lobby at this hotel is dark, and the carpet is badily worn. The "sky bridge" connecting the hotel to the airport is both better decorated and in better condition. There are four (or five) restaurants at the hotel, but two of them don't seem to be operated by the hotel. I had dinner La Huerta Cafe one evening and while the food was good, the ambiance offset the good food. It is just a dull, unimaginative restaurant. The two not run by the hotel seem to be much "nicer." I would have had diner at one of them, but I did not see them until I had already had dinner. I have stayed at other Camino Real hotels and they are have been beautiful properties. I hope they will either completely renovate this one or take their name off of it. If this was the first Camino Real hotel that I had stayed in, it would be my last. I have posted photos of my room on webshots.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a convenience stay”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after getting in one night late and having an early AM connection the next day. The lobby is very nice and very pretty, and thankfully they have 24-hour room service, and friendly and English-speaking staff. While standing in the lobby, it looks like a very fine hotel. The rooms are clean but small and rundown. Fixtures are fine but old. The walls are literally paper-thin, and I could hear things going on in the hall and in other rooms. Ordered some pizza from room service and wished I hadn't. However, you can't beat the convenience factor and location. The hotel is literally right across from the domestic ticket counters, and then a short 2 minute walk across a footbridge to the main lobby. If placed in the same situation, with a late arrival and early departure, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK at weekend rates, otherwise aripoff”
Reviews.Author: dubainick
Reviews.Content: At $110 per night + taxes for weekend rates this is OK -and convenient for 7am flight. Rooms are well insulated, beds are OK. But $185 week rate - I would have been up in arms. The bathroom and general decor are the main issues - miniature bath room with sink positioned outside in the main room - like a cheap bed and breakfast. General decor is just cheap looking. Health club is a joke - music blasting out with a farce of a pool - not even properly filled and a step right around so messing up and ability to do laps. Service used was fine, but generally hotel really needs a revamp and would only use for weekends preferably with early flight.

HotelInfo.Name: Camino Real Aeropuerto
HotelInfo.Address: Puerto Mexico 80, Mexico City 15520, Mexico
